programme.desc: Nuno Espirito Santo and Nottingham Forest bring back-to-back wins to the capital, as Thomas Frank's Brentford look to end the visitors' winning run at the Gtech Community Stadium. (21.12)

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Flock and Roll. It's hard enough for Mojo and Bo to help Jackson get all his sheep back in their pen, but it's even harder when the hungry sheep start chewing up Preston's flower festival!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Faceytalk. Bluey and Bingo love to video chat with their cousins, but Muffin won't give Socks a turn.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Army. Jack's the new dog at school and the newest recruit in Rusty's army. Jack struggles with following instructions and always forgets his hat, but Rusty will make a soldier of him yet.

programme.title: New: Piripenguins
programme.desc: A Whale of a Problem. The Piripenguins encounter a massive, angry whale. Can they find a way to cheer him up?

programme.title: Topsy and Tim
programme.desc: Dad's Office. Live-action children's show. Topsy and Tim go with Dad to his office for the morning and meet all the people that work with him at Helpful Drivers Minibuses.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle's Homework. Waffle's forgotten to do his homework, and Mr Nolan decides if he can continue as a pupil.

programme.title: Puffin Rock
programme.desc: Bernie and the Bee. Oona and Baba help Bernie and a little bee.

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: It's Time to Visit the Market. JoJo and Gran Gran visit the market to buy fresh fish from their friend Navid.

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: Pepi Nana and Mr Onion in the Tub! Pepi Nana finds the little toy tub hiding in her wardrobe. Little Nana wishes the little toy tub was a great big tub.

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Treasure Hunt. Things are disappearing - Major's spanner, Mother's trowel. But where could they be going?

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: Look What the Ball Did! The ball bounces all over the garden. It accidentally knocks over Makka Pakka's pile of stones, so Makka Pakka rebuilds it and tries to protect it.

programme.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: Vernon Kay - Hip and Hop: You Can Do Anything. Vernon Kay encourages you to focus on your dreams in this Bedtime Story.

programme.title: Memory
programme.desc: (2022) Action with Liam Neeson as a septuagenarian hitman; Monica Bellucci as a villain who hires hitmen to hit him, and Guy Pearce as an FBI agent investigating it all.

programme.title: Transformers: Age of Extinction
programme.desc: (2014) Mark Wahlberg stars in part four of the sci-fi action saga. The US has banned co-operation with Autobot and Decepticon aliens. But some have their own agenda.

programme.title: The Horne Section TV Show
programme.desc: The Special Guest: Sitcom starring Alex Horne and The Horne Section. The Pope is booked as the show's special guest and Nelly takes a shine to Gemma the new work experience girl.

programme.title: The Horne Section TV Show

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Little Girl in the Big Ten: Lisa pretends to be a student so that she can hang out with some college girls. Meanwhile, Bart is bitten by a mosquito.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Frying Game: Homer and Marge are framed for murder and face the electric chair. Guest starring Carmen Electra as herself.

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.desc: Hunka Hunka Burns in Love: Homer gets a job writing fortune cookie messages, one of which tells Mr Burns he will find love.

programme.title: Cheers

programme.title: The King of Queens

programme.title: The King of Queens

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Match Game: Frasier hires an attractive professional matchmaker (Laura Linney) but ends up on a string of bad dates. Meanwhile, Niles and Daphne plan a natural birth.

programme.title: New: Jamie's Dyslexia Revolution
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver explores the challenges and issues faced by thousands of school children with dyslexia who are left behind in an archaic education system and asks: what more can be done?

programme.title: New: BETH
programme.desc: Compelling drama. A miracle birth unravels a marriage and rocks the very foundation of humankind. Starring Nicholas Pinnock and Abbey Lee.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do Britain's sharpest armchair critics think of Slow Horses, Dating Naked, Celebrity Race Across the World and more?

programme.title: First Dates

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Sabatiello's: Gordon Ramsay sets his sights on Sabatiello's, an Italian restaurant in Connecticut, that's better known for its owner Sammy's tantrums than the food.

programme.title: Our Guy in Vietnam
programme.desc: On the 50th anniversary of the end of the Vietnam War, Guy Martin gets on his bike and heads down the Ho Chi Minh Trail exploring the past, present and future of Vietnam. (Ep1/2)

programme.title: Levison Wood: Walking with...
programme.desc: ...Orangutans: Explorer Levison Wood tracks down some of our planet's most iconic but threatened animals. In Borneo, he gets up close with the last-remaining endangered orangutans. (Ep1/3)

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours in Málaga
programme.desc: David O'Doherty joins Joe Lycett for a Costa del stroll along the Caminito del Rey, a 100-year-old barrel drink, a spot of dolphin watching and a visit to Picasso's birthplace.

programme.title: Jamie's Comfort Food Bites
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver takes the nation's favourite dishes to the next level, with reinvented classics and upgrades to British staples. In this episode, Jamie cooks curried fish pie.

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George meets a couple who are creating a crash pad from a scrapped jet plane, and a dad building a home on a tiny budget. He also visits a heavenly garden oasis in the city.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Grace finds herself in a tense confrontation, and a shocking event sets off a chain of blame. A haunting letter brings Mercedes face-to-face with her past, and buried trauma rears its head.

programme.title: Cheers

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: The Gift of the Woodi: Rebecca decides to sharpen her image and goes to Lilith for advice on power-dressing. Woody can't compete when it comes to expensive presents for Kelly.

programme.title: Cheers

programme.title: Armageddon
programme.desc: (1998) Michael Bay's star-studded disaster movie starring Bruce Willis. The world's greatest drillers are sent into space to nuke a huge asteroid that's hurtling towards Earth.

programme.title: Piggy
programme.desc: (2022) Suspenseful slasher horror starring Laura Galán as a bullied teenager whose tormentors get what's coming to 'em, but perhaps not in a way she'd fully support... In Spanish/subs.

programme.title: The Woman in the Fifth
programme.desc: (1997) Drama with Ethan Hawke and Kristin Scott Thomas. A lonely writer falls for a mysterious and possibly dangerous woman in Paris. In English/French/Polish/subs. Strong language/sex.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Tad the Lost Explorer and the...
programme.desc: ...Curse of the Mummy: (2022) Animated family adventure. After Tad accidentally unleashes a curse - doh! - he and his friends must find the Emerald Tablet to save the world.

programme.title: Cat Ballou
programme.desc: (1965) Oscar-winning comedy western starring Jane Fonda and Lee Marvin. She's trying to defend her father's ranch from developers, he's the drunken gunslinger she hires for the job.

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: (1989) Comedy-thriller starring Tom Hanks. A cop investigates a murder to which there's just one witness: Hooch, a slobbering, beer-drinking French mastiff, who now needs 24/7 protection.

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: (1993) Harold Ramis's classic déjà-vu comedy starring Bill Murray. A TV weatherman must relive the same day reporting on a clairvoyant groundhog until he learns to behave himself.

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: (2018) Nautical action thriller. Gerard Butler stars as an unconventional submarine skipper sent to investigate the torpedoing of a US vessel. With Gary Oldman, Linda Cardellini and Common.

programme.title: Peppermint
programme.desc: (2018) Revenge thriller with Jennifer Garner. A mum turns vigilante on a quest for justice when her husband and daughter are murdered by a drug cartel.

programme.title: Our Ladies
programme.desc: (2019) Raucous teen comedy. A group of Catholic school girls hit Edinburgh for a choir competition, but they're more interested in debauchery than singing.

programme.title: Skin
programme.desc: (2018) Intense biographical drama starring Jamie Bell as a Neo-Nazi skinhead who decides to leave his racist beliefs behind.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: DeSign
programme.desc: Chris helps future-proof a family's hallway for Tom, a boy recently diagnosed with Usher Syndrome.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Winslow Boy
programme.desc: (1948) Anthony Asquith's drama based on a famous 1912 court case with Cedric Hardwicke as the father of a boy accused of theft who pursues the case to the highest courts. With Robert Donat.

programme.title: River of No Return
programme.desc: (1954) Western with Robert Mitchum and Marilyn Monroe. An ex-con and a saloon singer steer a raft through hostile territory to face a showdown with her crooked fiancé. With Rory Calhoun.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: (1954) Western starring Dana Andrews. A man falsely accused of murder gets a last-minute reprieve from the lynch mob so he can track down the real culprit.

programme.title: Three Billboards Interview Special
programme.desc: Writer-director Martin McDonagh and star Sam Rockwell talk about making the comedy-drama about one woman's unconventional fight for justice.

programme.title: The Wrong Box
programme.desc: (1966) Dark comedy with John Mills, Ralph Richardson and Michael Caine. Two brothers clash over money that their parents left to their last surviving child, with chaotic consequences.

programme.title: Old Boys
programme.desc: (2018) Charming comedy set in an all-boys school in the 80s. An awkward geek gets caught in a love triangle with a teacher's daughter and the school sports star.

programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: (2004) Revenge thriller with Denzel Washington. An ex-CIA agent who's trying to start a new life in Mexico seeks brutal retribution when the girl who he's been hired to guard is kidnapped.

programme.title: Primal
programme.desc: (2019) Action-packed thriller starring Nicolas Cage. When both animals and assassins are let loose on a cargo ship, it's up to veteran-turned-poacher Frank Walsh to save the day.

programme.title: The Selfish Giant
programme.desc: (2013) Drama. Two excluded schoolboys get involved in the shadowy and dangerous world of unscrupulous scrap metal dealing. Starring Conner Chapman and Shaun Thomas. Very strong language.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Storm over the Nile
programme.desc: (1955) Drama. Anthony Steel stars as a disgraced soldier who, during the British army's 1898 campaign in Sudan, goes way beyond the call of duty to prove his courage. With Laurence Harvey.

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog
programme.desc: (1955) Atmospheric Victorian melodrama. Stewart Granger plays a sinister aristocrat who poisons his wife. However, his maid (Jean Simmons) knows his secret and tries to use it against him.

programme.title: The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw
programme.desc: (1959) Comedy western with Kenneth More. An English gunsmith decides the Wild West is the best market for his wares, but little does he expect to end up sheriff of a lawless frontier town.

programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: (1950) Western starring James Stewart. A gold prospector, tired of reprisal killings between whites and Native Americans, offers a truce to the Apaches' leader. But tensions resurface.

programme.title: Fatherhood
programme.desc: (2021) Heartfelt fact-based comedy-drama. Kevin Hart stars as a widower who is suddenly sprung into single fatherhood after his wife dies a day after giving birth.

programme.title: Venom: Let There Be Carnage
programme.desc: (2021) Tom Hardy returns as Marvel's gnarly antihero, to face a symbiote spawned from Venom's own blood living inside a serial killer who looks just like Woody Harrelson. Yikes.

programme.title: Crush
programme.desc: (2022) Romcom with Rowan Blanchard. When a high-school artist is accused of being Banksy-wannabe 'King Pun', she must clear her name. She's even forced to join the track team. #sonotcool.

programme.title: Good Afternoon Britain
programme.desc: Tackling the big stories from all angles and perspectives. Weekdays from midday, Tom Harwood and Emily Carver bring you the most compelling stories from across the United Kingdom.

programme.title: Martin Daubney
programme.desc: Join Martin for an up-to-the-minute take on the day's events delivered in his own unique and lively style.

programme.title: Dewbs & Co
programme.desc: Plain-speaking, straight-talking - Michelle delivers her individual take on the day's news.

programme.title: Farage
programme.desc: Nigel Farage doesn't hold back in his GB News prime-time show. Hear his views and give your own in an hour of discussion and debate. Join Nigel as he takes on the big stories other media won't touch.

programme.title: Jacob Rees-Mogg's State Of The Nation
programme.desc: Join Jacob for his unique and unmissable take on the day's news.

programme.title: Patrick Christys Tonight
programme.desc: Join Patrick for two hours of spirited debate and news making interviews. Top guests tackle the issues that matter, with a sharp take on every story.

programme.title: Headliners
programme.desc: The paper review that won't put you to sleep; join the all-star comedy cast for an intelligent and insightful look at tomorrow's headlines tonight.

programme.title: New: Fake
programme.desc: Run: Gripping drama series. Joe raids his family, reunites with his girlfriend Kristy, and refuses to sign divorce papers as he scrambles to cancel the auction of his family home.

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Oscar-winning crime drama film starring Tom Hanks and Tyler Hoechlin, 2002. A Mob enforcer's son witnesses a murder in 1930s Chicago, forcing him and his father to flee the city.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith: A Celebration
programme.desc: A special tribute to the enigmatic actress Maggie Smith - discover her life story, told by the people who knew her best, and celebrate her much-loved appearances.

programme.desc: Your daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.

programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern is back, and this time he's got the return of Roll It, everyone's favourite phone game Left Hanging, and the risky guessing game Whatever The Weather.

programme.desc: James looks forward to Soccer Aid 2025 with Harry Redknapp while cooking for classical singer Carly Paoli and enjoying recipes from chefs Sally Abe and Daniel Clifford.

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Period crime drama starring Tom Hanks and Paul Newman. The Midwest in the 1930s: when the profession of ruthless hitman Michael Sullivan is discovered, a killer is sent to eradicate him and his family. But Sullivan and his 12-year-old son escape and embark upon a life-changing journey of revenge.

programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith: A Celebration
programme.desc: A tribute to the celebrated and enigmatic actress, with her life story told by those who knew her best, celebrating her much-loved appearances across film and TV spanning almost 70 years. Smith, who died in September 2024, had gained a new level of popularity playing the razor-tongued Lady Violet Crawley in Downton Abbey, but for all her success, remained a very private person who had little time for the trappings that came with fame. The film tells the story of a girl born in pre-war Essex who, against the odds, took Broadway and the West End by storm before eventually becoming one of the world's most popular and respected performers

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Food and Wine Tour: Australia
programme.desc: Gary is in South Australia to meet his old friend Andi Peters. Starting their journey at the Yalumba Winery in the Barossa Valley, the duo try barrel-making, encounter the rare bees of Kangaroo Island, and visit the famous McLaren Vale, before blending their own vino with the Willy Wonka of Wine

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, featuring the return of Roll It and phone game Left Hanging as well as the chance for people to win a thousand pounds in In for A Penny, In for a Grand

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James looks forward to Soccer Aid 2025 with Harry Redknapp, cooks for classical singer Carly Paoli and enjoys recipes from chefs Sally Abe and Daniel Clifford

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Joe Wicks to try South African dancing, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the show's first male guest of honour, and Aldo Zilli dishes up a delicious brunch

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: The host is joined by actress Barbara Flynn and The Repair Shop stars Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch. Alan also gets a masterclass in milking goats, surveys some vintage bicycles and samples the best red wines for summer

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined by businessman and good friend Tom Skinner to enjoy Hong Kong's nod to an English fry-up and go on the ultimate street food tour around the central part of the city. Tom also gets to experience Hong Kong's famous fish market, which ends with a royal banquet, and is set up with a surprise visit to the city's oldest stamp carver and curator for a little holiday memento. Along the way, Jeremy's recipes include cheung fun, a savoury doughnut topped with a sweetened soy sauce

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a historic Scottish palace and gardens, Henry Agg builds a DIY pergola, Martha Swales offers a special allotment tour with her dad, and Errol Reuben Fernandes visits a unique Berkshire garden

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Robin Williams. In 1969, a young boy called Alan gets trapped in the strange jungle world of a magical board game he has unearthed on a building site. Twenty-six years later, two children discover the game and unwittingly unleash its dangerous magic. They also release Alan, now an adult, who realises that to escape the game they must play it to the end.

programme.title: You Only Live Twice
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery and Donald Pleasence. When international crime syndicate Spectre captures an American spaceship in the hope of starting the Third World War, James Bond is dispatched to Japan to face arch villain Blofeld, the man behind the evil scheme.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean Batty travels to the Black Isle, where he visits a local brewery and the Cromarty Community Cinema before going dolphin watching and finding out about Scotland's first managed coastal realignment.

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Fergus Sutherland explores his home town of Cumbernauld, and Jennifer Reoch goes to Benbecula to find out about the time a grizzly bear called Hercules went missing on the island

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Final
programme.desc: Portugal v Spain (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the showpiece match, held at Allianz Arena in Munich. Portugal came back from behind to defeat Germany 2-1 in the semi-finals and are now looking to emulate their triumph in the inaugural staging of this tournament in 2019. However, they face a tough test against Spain, who are the holders and withstood a late fightback from France in the last four to prevail 5-4. With analysis from Karen Carney and Guillem Balague, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Andros Townsend

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Island: Decade of Love
programme.desc: Memorable contestants from the past decade of Love Island reunite for an unmissable anniversary event, from explosive recouplings and shock bombshells to the love stories that captured the nation. They reflect on unforgettable moments from the villa and look back at previously unseen audition clips

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Donington Park with racing from the Porsche Carrera Cup Great Britain and the Wera Tools F4 British Championship.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: The chef goes on a culinary trip to Hong Kong, with celebrity friends joining him to delve into the heart of Cantonese culture and its world-famous gastronomy. His companion for the first instalment is Mel Giedroyc, with the pair taking in the sights, sampling a variety of street food and ending at one of Hong Kong's institutions for the best dim sum in town

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan shares more practical tips and seasonal highlights from his own patch, Anna Greenland explores the renowned dry garden at Hyde Hall in Essex and offers inspiration for planting in hot and dry conditions without compromising on beauty. Houseplant expert Claire Lowrie returns to tackle some of the most common indoor plant dilemmas

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the quiz in which three pairs of contestants use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. This edition features features mother and son Sharon and Sean from Norfolk, Nottingham siblings Amit and Alon, and Linda and her son-in-law Peter from Bromsgrove

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Kerry, Ellena, Alex and Fraser pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: John is questioned by the police, Tracy tries to defend herself, and Jacob learns Sarah's secret

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Brody complains about Kit's harassment, Millie drops a bombshell on Todd, Lou begs a favour of Gary, Toyah warns Ronnie not to mess Leanne around, and Carla shares her concern for Lisa with Betsy

programme.title: Shardlake
programme.desc: Dark deeds are perpetrated in a 16th-century English monastery in a four-part thriller adapted by screenwriter Stephen Butchard from the first book in CJ Sansom's series of novels. Idealistic lawyer Matthew Shardlake (Arthur Hughes) works for Thomas Cromwell (Sean Bean) and is dedicated to serving justice and the Crown. He is flanked by cocky assistant Jack Barak (Anthony Boyle), who could be a spy for Cromwell. Shardlake is living with scoliosis and is rudely dismissed as a 'crookback' by Tudor society as he carries out his duties. Weathering the verbal abuse, Shardlake and Barak travel to the remote town of Scarnsea to investigate the murder of a commissioner, who was gathering evidence for Cromwell to close the local monastery. The duo are met with hostility and suspicion as they seek answers from Abbot Fabian (Babou Ceesay) and a secretive brotherhood including Edwig (David Pearse), Gabriel (Miles Barrow), Guy (Irfan Shamji), Jerome (Paul Kaye) and Mortimus (Brian Vernel)

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Love Island
programme.desc: A fresh batch of singles prepare for the summer of a lifetime in the ultimate search for love, with host Maya Jama overseeing proceedings at the villa in Majorca

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: The British Soap Awards 2025
programme.desc: Jane McDonald hosts the annual ceremony from London's Hackney Empire, honouring 12 months in soap. It was an era which saw Helen Worth, better known as Coronation Street's Gail Platt, bid farewell to the cobbles after 50 years. EastEnders also celebrated its 40th anniversary, Hollyoaks had a dramatic leap into the future, and Emmerdale featured a frozen lake crash. Aside from highlights of those events, guests will present awards across key categories, including those voted for by the public - Villain of the Year, Best Comedy Performer, Best Leading Performer, and Best British Soap. Also up for grabs are Best Dramatic Performance, Best Newcomer, Best Storyline and more. Plus, one star will receive the Outstanding Achievement Award

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James treats chef Lesley Waters to a dish of pasta and artichokes, and enjoys a dessert of potato and chicory root from Michelin-starred chef Tommy Banks. He gives a masterclass in cooking onions and serves up a mouth-watering coq au vin for Madness singer Suggs and guests Daniel Galmiche, Dipna Anand and Alysia Vasey

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Newcastle couple Jack and Chloe, Sunny and his wife Sophie from London, and mother and son Sally and Ash from Pontypool in Wales use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Hosted by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Dave, Theo, Simone and Alvin pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Live International Football
programme.desc: England v Senegal (Kick-off 7.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the friendly at The City Ground in Nottingham. These teams last met in the last 16 of the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar, when England claimed a comfortable 3-0 win thanks to goals by Jordan Henderson, Harry Kane and Bukayo Saka. However, Senegal have largely been in good form since then, rising to the top 20 of the FIFA rankings, and will be looking to impress this evening. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: The 1% Club for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Lee Mack hosts a special charity edition of the quiz in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred sports stars and celebrities begin the show, but who will make it to the end and win up to £100,000 for charity

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Period crime drama starring Tom Hanks and Paul Newman. The Midwest in the 1930s: when the profession of ruthless hitman Michael Sullivan is discovered, a killer is sent to eradicate him and his family. But Sullivan and his 12-year-old son escape and embark upon a life-changing journey of revenge.

programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith: A Celebration
programme.desc: A tribute to the celebrated and enigmatic actress, with her life story told by those who knew her best, celebrating her much-loved appearances across film and TV spanning almost 70 years. Smith, who died in September 2024, had gained a new level of popularity playing the razor-tongued Lady Violet Crawley in Downton Abbey, but for all her success, remained a very private person who had little time for the trappings that came with fame. The film tells the story of a girl born in pre-war Essex who, against the odds, took Broadway and the West End by storm before eventually becoming one of the world's most popular and respected performers

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Food and Wine Tour: Australia
programme.desc: Gary is in South Australia to meet his old friend Andi Peters. Starting their journey at the Yalumba Winery in the Barossa Valley, the duo try barrel-making, encounter the rare bees of Kangaroo Island, and visit the famous McLaren Vale, before blending their own vino with the Willy Wonka of Wine

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, featuring the return of Roll It and phone game Left Hanging as well as the chance for people to win a thousand pounds in In for A Penny, In for a Grand

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James looks forward to Soccer Aid 2025 with Harry Redknapp, cooks for classical singer Carly Paoli and enjoys recipes from chefs Sally Abe and Daniel Clifford

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Joe Wicks to try South African dancing, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the show's first male guest of honour, and Aldo Zilli dishes up a delicious brunch

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: The host is joined by actress Barbara Flynn and The Repair Shop stars Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch. Alan also gets a masterclass in milking goats, surveys some vintage bicycles and samples the best red wines for summer

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined by businessman and good friend Tom Skinner to enjoy Hong Kong's nod to an English fry-up and go on the ultimate street food tour around the central part of the city. Tom also gets to experience Hong Kong's famous fish market, which ends with a royal banquet, and is set up with a surprise visit to the city's oldest stamp carver and curator for a little holiday memento. Along the way, Jeremy's recipes include cheung fun, a savoury doughnut topped with a sweetened soy sauce

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a historic Scottish palace and gardens, Henry Agg builds a DIY pergola, Martha Swales offers a special allotment tour with her dad, and Errol Reuben Fernandes visits a unique Berkshire garden

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Robin Williams. In 1969, a young boy called Alan gets trapped in the strange jungle world of a magical board game he has unearthed on a building site. Twenty-six years later, two children discover the game and unwittingly unleash its dangerous magic. They also release Alan, now an adult, who realises that to escape the game they must play it to the end.

programme.title: You Only Live Twice
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery and Donald Pleasence. When international crime syndicate Spectre captures an American spaceship in the hope of starting the Third World War, James Bond is dispatched to Japan to face arch villain Blofeld, the man behind the evil scheme.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean Batty travels to the Black Isle, where he visits a local brewery and the Cromarty Community Cinema before going dolphin watching and finding out about Scotland's first managed coastal realignment.

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Fergus Sutherland explores his home town of Cumbernauld, and Jennifer Reoch goes to Benbecula to find out about the time a grizzly bear called Hercules went missing on the island

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Final
programme.desc: Portugal v Spain (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the showpiece match, held at Allianz Arena in Munich. Portugal came back from behind to defeat Germany 2-1 in the semi-finals and are now looking to emulate their triumph in the inaugural staging of this tournament in 2019. However, they face a tough test against Spain, who are the holders and withstood a late fightback from France in the last four to prevail 5-4. With analysis from Karen Carney and Guillem Balague, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Andros Townsend

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Island: Decade of Love
programme.desc: Memorable contestants from the past decade of Love Island reunite for an unmissable anniversary event, from explosive recouplings and shock bombshells to the love stories that captured the nation. They reflect on unforgettable moments from the villa and look back at previously unseen audition clips

programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Donington Park with racing from the Porsche Carrera Cup Great Britain and the Wera Tools F4 British Championship.

Houseplant expert Claire Lowrie returns to tackle some of the most common indoor plant dilemmas

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the quiz in which three pairs of contestants use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. This edition features features mother and son Sharon and Sean from Norfolk, Nottingham siblings Amit and Alon, and Linda and her son-in-law Peter from Bromsgrove

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Kerry, Ellena, Alex and Fraser pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: John is questioned by the police, Tracy tries to defend herself, and Jacob learns Sarah's secret

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Brody complains about Kit's harassment, Millie drops a bombshell on Todd, Lou begs a favour of Gary, Toyah warns Ronnie not to mess Leanne around, and Carla shares her concern for Lisa with Betsy

programme.title: Shardlake
programme.desc: Dark deeds are perpetrated in a 16th-century English monastery in a four-part thriller adapted by screenwriter Stephen Butchard from the first book in CJ Sansom's series of novels. Idealistic lawyer Matthew Shardlake (Arthur Hughes) works for Thomas Cromwell (Sean Bean) and is dedicated to serving justice and the Crown. He is flanked by cocky assistant Jack Barak (Anthony Boyle), who could be a spy for Cromwell. Shardlake is living with scoliosis and is rudely dismissed as a 'crookback' by Tudor society as he carries out his duties. Weathering the verbal abuse, Shardlake and Barak travel to the remote town of Scarnsea to investigate the murder of a commissioner, who was gathering evidence for Cromwell to close the local monastery. The duo are met with hostility and suspicion as they seek answers from Abbot Fabian (Babou Ceesay) and a secretive brotherhood including Edwig (David Pearse), Gabriel (Miles Barrow), Guy (Irfan Shamji), Jerome (Paul Kaye) and Mortimus (Brian Vernel)

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: The British Soap Awards 2025
programme.desc: Jane McDonald hosts the annual ceremony from London's Hackney Empire, honouring 12 months in soap. It was an era which saw Helen Worth, better known as Coronation Street's Gail Platt, bid farewell to the cobbles after 50 years. EastEnders also celebrated its 40th anniversary, Hollyoaks had a dramatic leap into the future, and Emmerdale featured a frozen lake crash. Aside from highlights of those events, guests will present awards across key categories, including those voted for by the public - Villain of the Year, Best Comedy Performer, Best Leading Performer, and Best British Soap. Also up for grabs are Best Dramatic Performance, Best Newcomer, Best Storyline and more. Plus, one star will receive the Outstanding Achievement Award

He gives a masterclass in cooking onions and serves up a mouth-watering coq au vin for Madness singer Suggs and guests Daniel Galmiche, Dipna Anand and Alysia Vasey

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Newcastle couple Jack and Chloe, Sunny and his wife Sophie from London, and mother and son Sally and Ash from Pontypool in Wales use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Hosted by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Dave, Theo, Simone and Alvin pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: Live International Football
programme.desc: England v Senegal (Kick-off 7.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the friendly at The City Ground in Nottingham. These teams last met in the last 16 of the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar, when England claimed a comfortable 3-0 win thanks to goals by Jordan Henderson, Harry Kane and Bukayo Saka. However, Senegal have largely been in good form since then, rising to the top 20 of the FIFA rankings, and will be looking to impress this evening. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Period crime drama starring Tom Hanks and Paul Newman. The Midwest in the 1930s: when the profession of ruthless hitman Michael Sullivan is discovered, a killer is sent to eradicate him and his family. But Sullivan and his 12-year-old son escape and embark upon a life-changing journey of revenge.

programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith: A Celebration
programme.desc: A tribute to the celebrated and enigmatic actress, with her life story told by those who knew her best, celebrating her much-loved appearances across film and TV spanning almost 70 years. Smith, who died in September 2024, had gained a new level of popularity playing the razor-tongued Lady Violet Crawley in Downton Abbey, but for all her success, remained a very private person who had little time for the trappings that came with fame. The film tells the story of a girl born in pre-war Essex who, against the odds, took Broadway and the West End by storm before eventually becoming one of the world's most popular and respected performers

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Food and Wine Tour: Australia
programme.desc: Gary is in South Australia to meet his old friend Andi Peters. Starting their journey at the Yalumba Winery in the Barossa Valley, the duo try barrel-making, encounter the rare bees of Kangaroo Island, and visit the famous McLaren Vale, before blending their own vino with the Willy Wonka of Wine

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, featuring the return of Roll It and phone game Left Hanging as well as the chance for people to win a thousand pounds in In for A Penny, In for a Grand

programme.desc: The host is joined by actress Barbara Flynn and The Repair Shop stars Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch. Alan also gets a masterclass in milking goats, surveys some vintage bicycles and samples the best red wines for summer

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined by businessman and good friend Tom Skinner to enjoy Hong Kong's nod to an English fry-up and go on the ultimate street food tour around the central part of the city. Tom also gets to experience Hong Kong's famous fish market, which ends with a royal banquet, and is set up with a surprise visit to the city's oldest stamp carver and curator for a little holiday memento. Along the way, Jeremy's recipes include cheung fun, a savoury doughnut topped with a sweetened soy sauce

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Robin Williams. In 1969, a young boy called Alan gets trapped in the strange jungle world of a magical board game he has unearthed on a building site. Twenty-six years later, two children discover the game and unwittingly unleash its dangerous magic. They also release Alan, now an adult, who realises that to escape the game they must play it to the end.

programme.title: You Only Live Twice
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery and Donald Pleasence. When international crime syndicate Spectre captures an American spaceship in the hope of starting the Third World War, James Bond is dispatched to Japan to face arch villain Blofeld, the man behind the evil scheme.

programme.title: The People's History Show

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Final
programme.desc: Portugal v Spain (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the showpiece match, held at Allianz Arena in Munich. Portugal came back from behind to defeat Germany 2-1 in the semi-finals and are now looking to emulate their triumph in the inaugural staging of this tournament in 2019. However, they face a tough test against Spain, who are the holders and withstood a late fightback from France in the last four to prevail 5-4. With analysis from Karen Carney and Guillem Balague, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Andros Townsend

programme.title: Shardlake
programme.desc: Dark deeds are perpetrated in a 16th-century English monastery in a four-part thriller adapted by screenwriter Stephen Butchard from the first book in CJ Sansom's series of novels. Idealistic lawyer Matthew Shardlake (Arthur Hughes) works for Thomas Cromwell (Sean Bean) and is dedicated to serving justice and the Crown. He is flanked by cocky assistant Jack Barak (Anthony Boyle), who could be a spy for Cromwell. Shardlake is living with scoliosis and is rudely dismissed as a 'crookback' by Tudor society as he carries out his duties. Weathering the verbal abuse, Shardlake and Barak travel to the remote town of Scarnsea to investigate the murder of a commissioner, who was gathering evidence for Cromwell to close the local monastery. The duo are met with hostility and suspicion as they seek answers from Abbot Fabian (Babou Ceesay) and a secretive brotherhood including Edwig (David Pearse), Gabriel (Miles Barrow), Guy (Irfan Shamji), Jerome (Paul Kaye) and Mortimus (Brian Vernel)

programme.title: The British Soap Awards 2025
programme.desc: Jane McDonald hosts the annual ceremony from London's Hackney Empire, honouring 12 months in soap. It was an era which saw Helen Worth, better known as Coronation Street's Gail Platt, bid farewell to the cobbles after 50 years. EastEnders also celebrated its 40th anniversary, Hollyoaks had a dramatic leap into the future, and Emmerdale featured a frozen lake crash. Aside from highlights of those events, guests will present awards across key categories, including those voted for by the public - Villain of the Year, Best Comedy Performer, Best Leading Performer, and Best British Soap. Also up for grabs are Best Dramatic Performance, Best Newcomer, Best Storyline and more. Plus, one star will receive the Outstanding Achievement Award
